Project Update: Enhancements to ResumeStyledCertList Component

Overview:

The ResumeStyledCertList The component has been updated with significant improvements to enhance user experience (UX), readability, and functionality. The latest updates include dynamic total hours calculation, real-time data updating (PST/PDT), and sorting functionality for both date and hours spent per certification.

Key Updates:

1. Dynamic Total Hours Calculation

  • The total number of hours spent across all certifications is now calculated dynamically.

    reduce()

    .

  • This value updates automatically based on the certification data.

  • The formatted message is now prominently displayed:

    Example:

    With 450.5 ⏳ hours spent as of January 30, 2025, and only growing.

Implementation:

const totalHours = certifications.reduce((sum, cert) => sum + parseFloat(cert.length), 0);

2. Automatic Date Update (PST/PDT Timezone)

  • The displayed date updates dynamically to reflect the current date.

  • The system fetches the date once daily in the California (PST/PDT) timezone.

  • Uses

    Intl.DateTimeFormat

    with a 24-hour refresh interval.

Implementation:

useEffect(() => { const updateDate = () => { const options = { timeZone: "America/Los_Angeles", year: "numeric", month: "long", day: "numeric" }; const newDate = new Intl.DateTimeFormat("en-US", options).format(new Date()); setCurrentDate(newDate); }; updateDate(); // Update immediately on mount const interval = setInterval(updateDate, 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000); // Update every 24 hours return () => clearInterval(interval); // Cleanup on unmount }, []);

3. Sorting Functionality

Two sorting options have been added for better user control:

  1. Sort by Date

    (

    latest

    to

    oldest

    or vice versa)

  2. Sort by Length

    (

    largest

    to

    smallest

    hours spent per course)

Implementation:

const sortedCertifications = [...certifications].sort((a, b) => { if (sortByLength) { return b.length - a.length; // Largest to smallest } else { const dateA = new Date(a.date); const dateB = new Date(b.date); return sortOrder === "latest" ? dateB - dateA : dateA - dateB; } });

4. Updated UI & Styles for Sorting Buttons

  • Two sorting buttons have been added with improved UI styling.

  • Users can toggle between sorting methods dynamically.

  • Active sorting options are highlighted for clarity.

Button UI Example:

<Button onClick={() => setSortByLength(false) || setSortOrder(sortOrder === "latest" ? "oldest" : "latest")} style={{ backgroundColor: !sortByLength ? theme.colors.primary : theme.colors.muted }} > Sort by {sortOrder === "latest" ? "Oldest" : "Latest"} </Button> <Button onClick={() => setSortByLength(true)} style={{ backgroundColor: sortByLength ? theme.colors.primary : theme.colors.muted }} > Sort by Most Hours </Button>

Final Outcome

With these enhancements, the ResumeStyledCertList component now provides: ✅ A more engaging and informative UI. ✅ Real-time updates with accurate dates and hours spent. ✅ Sorting flexibility for both date and length. ✅ A modernized design for better UX readability.

These changes collectively improve user interaction and make the certification list more intuitive and dynamic.

Next Steps:

    filtering system

    (e.g., by category: CSS, JavaScript, Design).

  • Improve mobile responsiveness for sorting UI.

  • Implement local storage to persist user preferences for sorting.
